describe: You are standing in a field.
You stand in a grassy field.
You see before you a field full of vegetation.
enter: You step into the field's vegetation.

describe: You are standing in a stream that runs from east to west.
The water of the stream trickles through your toes to the west.
exit: You step out of the stream.

describe: You hear the rushing water of a stream to the south.
You hear water to your south.
enter: You hear rushing water to your south.

describe: You hear the rushing water of a stream to the north.
You hear water to your north.
enter: You hear rushing water to your north.

describe: You stand beneath the shade of the red tree.
The tree shades you from the sun.
enter: You step beneath the shade of the red tree.
The tree shades you from the sun.
exit: You step back into the sunlight.
You step out from underneath the red tree's shade.

describe: You stand in a patch of mud.
You stand in a mud patch.
You stand in a muddy puddle.
enter: You step in a puddle of mud.
You splash your feet through a mud puddle.
A mud puddle wets your shoes.
exit: You are glad you stepped out of the mud.

describe: You stand in a patch of mud.
You stand in a mud patch.
You stand in a muddy puddle.
enter: You step in a puddle of mud.
You splash your feet through a mud puddle.
A mud puddle wets your shoes.
exit: You are glad you stepped out of the mud.

describe: You stand in the shade of the ramada.
The orange roof of the ramada shields you from the sun's rays.
enter: You move under the ramada's shade.
You take shelter beneath the ramada.
exit: You venture out from beneath the ramada.
You leave the ramada, stepping into its vicinity.

describe: You see a picnic table.
touch: Your legs brush against the benches of the picnic table.
You run your hand along the rough surface of the picnic table.
You scrape gently against the edges of the table.

describe: You see a big red tree.
touch: You press against the red bark of the tree.
You push against the trunk of the red tree.
You approach the red tree, touching it.

describe: You stand at the southern border of the valley and should return north.
touch: Reverse your course and head north. To continue southerly is dangerous.

describe: You stand at the northern border of the valley and should return south.
touch: Reverse your course and head south. To continue northerly is dangerous.

describe: You stand at the eastern border of the valley and should return west.
touch: Reverse your course and head west. To continue easterly is dangerous.

describe: You stand at the western border of the valley and should return east.
touch: Reverse your course and head east. To continue westerly is dangerous.
